attributes.action: Give the Police powers to distroy child porn, in any format, on completion of thier investigations regardless of it's original source and regardless of the outcome of any prosecution
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Avon and Somerset Police Chief Constable Colin Port has been ordered by the High Court to return 87 hard drives and 2500 images of child porn to a discredited I.T. expert following an order to prevent police continuing their probe.  Judgements like these need to be stopped. The police need to be  empowered to distroy this type of offensive material when they have concluded all possible avenues of investigation, regardless of it's original source and regardless of the success of any prosecution. British law should not protect individuals who possess Child pronography.

rejection.details: As explained in our terms and conditions (http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/terms) we cannot accept petitions which contain details of individual and/or ongoing legal cases. You may wish to re-word your petition to remove these details.
reasons: Information which may be protected by an injunction or court order
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
